Title: Digging Up the Truth
Content: Cʜᴀʀᴀᴄᴛᴇʀs
NELSON: 4th-grade student
MATT: Nelson's friend
LUCIA: Nelson's friend
MS. CHEN: Librarian
MR. LUND: Nelson's father
SCENE 1
[Late summer afternoon, outside the public library. Nelson and Matt wait for the bus.]
NELSON: What do you think of Writing Camp so far?
MATT: It's pretty cool. What did you write about today?

NELSON: A guy who's an astronaut. I had space travel on my mind from this great book I'm reading... [Digs in his backpack to pull out his book.] Hold on... [Digs some more.] Hey, I think I left my book inside. I'll be right back.
MATT: Hurry—the bus will be here soon.
[Nelson runs back into the library. Ms. Chen looks up when she hears the door.]
NELSON: Sorry to bother you, but I think I left something in here.
MS. CHEN: Feel free to look around, Nelson. What are you missing?
NELSON: It's a book called Space Ride. [Searches the area where he sat earlier.] Have you seen it?
MS. CHEN: No, but I'll help you look.
[Ms. Chen and Nelson search for a few minutes but don't find the book.]
MS. CHEN: Let's look again tomorrow morning. Maybe it will turn up.
NELSON: [Disappointed.] I hope so. Thanks, Ms. Chen.
[Nelson hurries out to the bus stop.]
SCENE 2
[The next morning. Matt and Nelson are walking into the library before camp.]
MATT: Did you ever find your book?
NELSON: [Sighs.] No. And I was just getting to the good part.
MATT: What's it called?
NELSON: Space Ride. Will you help me look?
MATT: Sure.
[The boys c͟h͟e͟c͟k all around but find nothing. They are walking to their seats, but Matt abruptly stops.]
MATT: Hey, Nelson, look at that. [Nods his head toward Lucia, who is reading Space Ride at the next table.]
NELSON: [Irritated.] Let's go talk to her.
[The two boys walk over to Lucia.]
NELSON: Hi, Lucia. Where'd you get that book?
LUCIA: [Looking up.] At the bookstore. Why?
NELSON: I lost my copy yesterday. Are you sure you didn't find it here?
LUCIA: [Shakes her head.] No, this one's mine.
[Nelson looks at Lucia suspiciously.]

LUCIA: [Closing the book and holding it to her chest.] You're not the only person who likes this book, Nelson. Besides, I'm on page 134. If I had just found the book, I couldn't have read this many pages already.
[Ms. Chen overhears the students talking and walks over to them.]
MS. CHEN: Nelson, there's no reason to assume that Lucia has your book.
NELSON: But Ms. Chen, I lost this same book yesterday, and today Lucia is reading it. Don't you think that's strange?

MS. CHEN: No, and we should trust Lucia. This book is very popular. The library even has a waiting list for it. You can keep looking for your book after camp. Now please have a seat so we can start writing.
[Nelson and Matt slowly walk back to their table. Nelson looks distressed.]
SCENE 3
[Later that evening. Nelson and Mr. Lund are sitting on the couch in their living room.]
NELSON: [Forcefully.] Dad, I just know Lucia has my book.
MR. LUND: Lucia said that was her copy, Nelson. Are you sure you've looked everywhere?
NELSON: I've searched the library a hundred times.
MR. LUND: How about your room? And in your backpack?
NELSON: [Shaking his head.] It's not in there, Dad.
MR. LUND: Why don't you look in your bag one more time? I'll hunt around here.
[Nelson opens his backpack and takes out all his belongings, one by one. He turns the backpack upside down and shakes it. A book falls out.]

NELSON: [Shocked.] Dad, the book was in my bag the whole time. Look, here. [Shows Mr. Lund the inside of his backpack.] The inside pocket is torn, and it must've slipped down into the lining of the bag. [Sticks his hand in the backpack. Smiles. Then looks concerned.] Poor Lucia was telling the truth all along. And Ms. Chen. She tried to help me.
MR. LUND: Well, tomorrow is a new day.
NELSON: You're right. I'll show the backpack to Lucia and Ms. Chen when I get to the library in the morning. I hope they'll understand and accept my apology.
MR. LUND: [Nodding his head.] That's a good plan.
NELSON: But now I have another plan.
[Nelson smiles and makes himself comfortable on the couch and opens up Space Ride.]
